revision.comment: /* OEF is not "the official name" of the WoT */
revision.text: {{Talk header|search=yes}} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Military history|class=B|importance=Top|Australian-task-force=yes|British-task-force=yes|Canadian-task-force=yes|French-task-force=yes|US-task-force=yes|War-on-Terrorism-task-force=yes |B-Class-1=no |B-Class-2=yes |B-Class-3=yes |B-Class-4=yes |B-Class-5=yes}} {{WikiProject Afghanistan|class=c|importance=top}} {{WikiProject Disaster management|class=c|importance=mid}} {{WikiProject Terrorism|class=c|importance=top}} {{WikiProject United States|class=c|importance=High}}}} == Operation Enduring Freedom =/= Fighting piracy == Operation Enduring Freedom refers specifically to USA's anti-terror operations in various parts of the world. Please do not mix various countries anti-terror operations with it. China or Iran sending their naval warships to Somalia to fight piracy has got nothing to do with Operation Enduring Freedom. Both Iran and China are not a part of [[Combined Task Force 150]] and [[Combined Task Force 151|151]]. --[[User:Nosedown|Nosedown]] ([[User talk:Nosedown|talk]]) 02:44, 25 May 2009 (UTC) == Why is FRENCH Flag noted under belligerents?? == This is not to diminish the contributions of any nation concerened, but on first glance, one might assume that FRANCE is contributing on a massive scale when they in fact, ARE NOT!! As of July, 2009, France actually ranks about 7th or 8th of all the NATO nations and has sustained 28 casualties from the start of their partipation. '''Canada''', on the other hand, with a "tiny" military in relation to France has continually fielded between '''2,500 and 3,000 troops''' from the very beginnning of this conflict. Frances current committment is about '''1,000''' and they are located just outside Kabul. Probably the LEAST dangerous sector in the entire country if any area can be described as such. France has also announced that they will be COMPLETELY withdrawing its committment. (and may in fact have aleady begun to do so??) The Canadians are currently tasked with partolling and figthing in one of the most dangerous provinces in all of Southern Afghanistan (along with the British) and are subject to attacks on a daily basis. They were one of (if not the very first) contributor to actually field Main Battle Tanks in support of their and other NATO troops. Tragically, Canada has up to this point sustained over '''120 dead''' (The third highest casualty rate after the US & Great Britain!!!), to France's 28. My point is this.... When one prominently notes the flag of a nation, that in reality is '''NOT''' doing the majority of the fighting and as a side note underneath states '''"and approximately 39 other nations"''', you have in effect, belittled and diminished the real sacrificies of others, and that is SHAMEFUL. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/99.239.34.128|99.239.34.128]] ([[User talk:99.239.34.128|talk]]) 16:01, 12 July 2009 (UTC) ''Emotion should not be taken into account. Shame and sacrifice are irrelevant. Simply because France is not doing the "majority" of the fighting does not mean that their contribution is not worth mentioning in an encyclopedia.'' ::I second the comment immediately above this one. [[User:Beingsshepherd|Beingsshepherd]] ([[User talk:Beingsshepherd|talk]]) 15:46, 4 August 2013 (UTC)Beingsshepherd == Strength(?) == Just noticed that this war/conflict does not have a "Strength" section in the summary/info area. I was curious to see what the US Troop Strength (ie # of troops there) was in Afghanistan but to no avail... Anyone know the #'s? [[Special:Contributions/76.171.90.37|76.171.90.37]] ([[User talk:76.171.90.37|talk]]) 01:15, 30 November 2009 (UTC) == Block evader == I've turned pending changes on in this article as a means of stopping the indef blocked editor {{user|Gameboy1947}} from editing it from IP accounts. He/she edits from the 119.x range, and it would be appreciated if other editors disallowed these changes. Thanks, [[User:Nick-D|Nick-D]] ([[User talk:Nick-D|talk]]) 10:27, 29 July 2010 (UTC) :Well, the 1209 casuality number is supported by the latest version of the reference. The reference for the wounded doesn't actually contain those numbers, so I removed it. [[User:Gerardw|Gerardw]] ([[User talk:Gerardw|talk]]) 18:08, 29 July 2010 (UTC) == Operation Enduring Freedom - Kyrgyzstan == I was wondering about the Operation Enduring Freedom in Kyrgyzstan. I didn't know that a full fledged anti-terrorist operation is going on there. I know that the US and other countries are using Manas Int'l Airport as a base but is there really, or was there really an operation there? I cannot really seem to find any information on that. Can someone please clue me in? [[User:JoeBlabbah|JoeBlabbah]] ([[User talk:JoeBlabbah|talk]]) 16:38, 7 August 2010 (UTC) == New People's Army/Jose Maria Sison == I removed these from the list of belligerents. Even though [[Operation Enduring Freedom – Philippines]] is part of the campaign, it's inaccurate to include [[New People's Army]] and [[Jose Maria Sison]] them in that conflict. Not to discount the fact that NPA has been classified by the United States as a terrorist organization, no mention is found in any OEF articles of either the group or Sison. [[User:Halda|Halda]] ([[User talk:Halda|talk]]) 15:08, 7 September 2010 (UTC) == The latest in updates on this particular topic: == Office of the Chief of Staff, Army General Officer Announcement September 20, 2010 The Chief of Staff, Army announces the assignment of the following officer: Brigadier General Ross E. Ridge, Commandant, United States Army Field Artillery School, United States Army Fires Center of Excellence, Fort Sill, Oklahoma to Commander, Task Force 2010, OPERATION ENDURING FREEDOM, Afghanistan. [[Special:Contributions/155.219.241.10|155.219.241.10]] ([[User talk:155.219.241.10|talk]]) 17:38, 20 September 2010 (UTC) Darian Dowdy, September 20, 2010 :What's the significance of this? [[User:Nick-D|Nick-D]] ([[User talk:Nick-D|talk]]) 07:22, 21 September 2010 (UTC) == OEF was a later name, initial operations in Afghanistan were under Operation Noble Venture == I don't know the date the name changed, but originally we were conducting operations under NV. [[User:DukeCCT|DukeCCT]] ([[User talk:DukeCCT|talk]]) 13:51, 29 October 2010 (UTC) DukeCCT == Abbreviations in the belligerents == I'm sorry if I missed anything, but why are abbreviations for all the belligerent countries being used? This confuses me immensely. [[User:CuboneKing|CuboneKing]] ([[User talk:CuboneKing|talk]]) 04:04, 24 August 2011 (UTC) == Useful here? Or where? == from [[Portal:Current events/2012 June 14]] ... *The U.S. military expands its secret network of air bases across Africa, according to reports in the U.S. media. ([http://www.aljazeera.com/news/africa/2012/06/20126146354300436.html 'US expanding spying network' in Africa]) Also ... from [[Washington Post]] *[http://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/us-expands-secret-intelligence-operations-in-africa/2012/06/13/gJQAHyvAbV_story.html U.S. expands secret intelligence operations in Africa] by Craig Whitlock, Published: June 13 *[http://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/contractors-run-us-spying-missions-in-africa/2012/06/14/gJQAvC4RdV_story.html Contractors run U.S. spying missions in Africa] June 14, 2012 It doesn't seem to fit into [[Trans-Saharan Counterterrorism Initiative]] / [[Operation Enduring Freedom – Trans Sahara]] alone (or [[Operation Enduring Freedom – Horn of Africa]]) [[Special:Contributions/99.181.131.205|99.181.131.205]] ([[User talk:99.181.131.205|talk]]) 05:03, 15 June 2012 (UTC) == Invitation information incorrect? == Regarding: : In 1996, Saudi dissident Osama bin Laden moved to Afghanistan upon the invitation of the Northern Alliance leader Abdur Rabb ur Rasool Sayyaf. I doubt the Northern Alliance would have anything to do with Osama bin Laden. What is the source? For instance, article ''[[Najim Jihad]]'' has: : In mid-1997, the Northern Alliance threatened to overrun Jalalabad, causing Bin Laden to abandon Nazim Jihad --[[User:Mortense|Mortense]] ([[User talk:Mortense|talk]]) 11:11, 28 October 2012 (UTC) == The Taliban == I propose deleting the subjective words: 'extreme' and 'harsh' from this section. I did so myself and my changes were (as nearly always) reverted. [[User:Beingsshepherd|Beingsshepherd]] ([[User talk:Beingsshepherd|talk]]) 15:44, 4 August 2013 (UTC)Beingsshepherd == OIF? == I was in Iraq in 2003 as an US Army soldier in 286TH Sig Co. attached to an ADA unit. I noticed that Operation Iraqi Freedom is not mentioned in this article anywhere. As we were told OIF was a part of OEF. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/69.123.230.253|69.123.230.253]] ([[User talk:69.123.230.253|talk]]) 13:16, 9 September 2013 (UTC) == Links/To do == Need to mention the security pact deliberations, perhaps as "result" [http://www.aljazeera.com/news/asia/2013/11/further-delays-us-deal-with-afghanistan-201311263545983309.html] + [http://www.aljazeera.com/news/asia/2013/12/us-halts-army-shipments-out-afghanistan-20131244293781618.html .> US halts army shipments out of Afghanistan ][http://www.aljazeera.com/news/asia/2013/12/failure-sign-pact-could-end-afghan-mission-20131230311626551.html >> Failure to sign pact could end Afghan mission ][http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2013-12-10/planes-parked-in-weeds-in-kabul-after-486-million-spent.html >> Planes Parked in Weeds in Kabul After $486 Million Spent][http://www.aljazeera.com/news/asia-pacific/2013/12/australian-troops-leave-afghanistan-201312169306647453.html >> Australian troops leave Afghanistan ][http://www.aljazeera.com/news/asia/2014/01/karzai-no-security-deal-without-peace-talks-20141259122260833.html >> Karzai: no security deal without peace talks][http://www.aljazeera.com/news/asia/2014/02/afghan-war-takes-rising-toll-civilians-20142842750131868.html >> Afghan war takes rising toll on civilians][http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/opinion/2014/03/can-un-save-afghanistan-20143134452256298.html >> Can the UN save Afghanistan? ]([[User:Lihaas|Lihaas]] ([[User talk:Lihaas|talk]]) 15:34, 26 November 2013 (UTC)). == Is it over? == I'm confused as to whether or not OEF is over. Two DOD sources give conflicting info. [http://www.defense.gov/news/Expeditionary-Medal-Service-Star-Authorization.pdf This] says it's still ongoing, yet [http://www.defense.gov/news/newsarticle.aspx?id=123887 this] says it's over. '''''[[User:Illegitimate Barrister|Illegitimate Barrister]]''''' 02:57, 20 March 2015 (UTC) :Better to error on the side of caution, if the campaign medal is still authorized, keep it open IMHO.--[[User:RightCowLeftCoast|RightCowLeftCoast]] ([[User talk:RightCowLeftCoast|talk]]) 03:01, 20 March 2015 (UTC) ::Alrightey, thanks. '''''[[User:Illegitimate Barrister|Illegitimate Barrister]]''''' 03:02, 20 March 2015 (UTC) {{od}}I've sent an e-mail to the DOD asking about this. I shall await an answer and report back. '''''[[User:Illegitimate Barrister|Illegitimate Barrister]]''''' 06:57, 21 March 2015 (UTC) :Alright, just got a reply back from the DOD's AFPS. It says: '''''"Good morning - Operation Enduring Freedom - Afghanistan ended Dec. 31, 2014. It was succeeded by Operation Freedom's Sentinel. Thank you for your query."''''' This pretty much confirms my suspicions that OEF is still ongoing, it's just that OEF-A is over. '''''[[User:Illegitimate Barrister|Illegitimate Barrister]]''''' 13:30, 25 March 2015 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just added archive links to {{plural:8|one external link|8 external links}} on [[Operation Enduring Freedom]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=678084671 my edit]. If necessary, add {{tlx|cbignore}} after the link to keep me from modifying it. Alternatively, you can add {{tlx|nobots|deny{{=}}InternetArchiveBot}} to keep me off the page altogether. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20080513094615/http://131.84.1.218:80/speeches/sst2003/030210pasoc.shtml to http://131.84.1.218/speeches/sst2003/030210pasoc.shtml *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20090326131527/http://131.84.1.218/piupdates/smiles.pdf to http://131.84.1.218/piupdates/smiles.pdf *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20110105114837/http://www.washington-report.org:80/backissues/0498/9804047.html to http://www.washington-report.org/backissues/0498/9804047.html *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20131104093339/http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/s/w_asia/70585.stm to http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/s/w_asia/70585.stm *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20100916091256/http://archives.cnn.com:80/2001/US/10/07/gen.america.under.attack/ to http://archives.cnn.com/2001/US/10/07/gen.america.under.attack/ *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20100412201517/http://www.army.mil/professionalwriting/volumes/volume2/june_2004/6_04_3.html to http://www.army.mil/professionalwriting/volumes/volume2/june_2004/6_04_3.html *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20141112092813/http://www.ict.org.il/organizations/orgdet.cfm?orgid=3 to http://www.ict.org.il/organizations/orgdet.cfm?orgid=3 *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20090325010400/http://www.senate.gov/member/al/shelby/general/legislation/Terrorism.pdf to http://www.senate.gov/member/al/shelby/general/legislation/Terrorism.pdf When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' to let others know. {{sourcecheck|checked=false}} Cheers. —[[User:Cyberbot II|cyberbot II]][[User talk:Cyberbot II|Talk to my owner]]:Online 08:57, 27 August 2015 (UTC) == OEF is not "the official name" of the WoT == Absent an "official" statement from an authorized US gov. official that corroborates the claim made in the first sentence of this article, it is simply false. OEF originally pertained exclusively to Afghanistan in distinction from the Iraq operations, all of which were under the umbrella term War on Terror. Granted WoT is a meaningless term to the extent it is defined as "US efforts to harm, defeat and destroy any person, organization or state the US designates as terrorist", but that does not mean that OEF is synonymous with WoT, either officially or colloquially. As this article notes, OEF "ended" and was replaced with OFS. As the WoT main article notes, Bush arguably coined the term WoT (which he used as a synonym for 'crusade') in 9/2001, and that term referred broadly to any fight against terrorists anywhere, not just Afghanistan. Obama even stopped using the term WoT altogether, preferring instead to use some other hopelessly ambiguous term - but not OEF. This may sound like pedantry but it is critical that terminology used as a euphemism for war has a reasonably objective definition. Sloppy language allows for things like calling the decades old US interventions in Central/South America OEF, and according to this article therefore part of the WoT, despite US involvement predating the WoT, despite the lack of belligerents on one side. This entire article is full of dubious claims, but the first sentence is fairly outrageous.[[User:BTercero|BTercero]] ([[User talk:BTercero|talk]]) 05:01, 9 June 2016 (UTC) :Lead adjusted to reflect sourced article content. ([[User:Hohum|'''Hohum''']] [[User talk:Hohum|@]]) 17:35, 9 June 2016 (UTC) ::Then what is OEF-A, et al? My email to the DOD was met with a reply that said OEF-A ended. You say that OEF ended in 2014, but [http://www.defense.gov/News/News-Releases/News-Release-View/Article/605375 this DOD page] from 2015 says it is still ongoing. – '''''[[User:Illegitimate Barrister|Illegitimate Barrister]]''''' ([[User_talk:Illegitimate_Barrister|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Illegitimate Barrister|contribs]]), 17:21, 22 September 2016 (UTC)
